post_text: Van Meter Schools want all the plastic bags that you have been saving! We are holding a plastic bag drive from July 1 to July 17 and will have a drop-off point outside the secondary school entrance marked with excellent signs. The plastic bags will be taken to Plastic Recycle of Iowa Falls that make a number of different products from recycled bags including benches. As Van Meter Schools continue to increase their environmental awareness efforts we will use the drive as a way to procure benches for the upcoming outdoor classroom and pond restoration area. It can take over 500 years to have one plastic bag decompose, so let us recycle them instead! Please help and spread the word and drop off all those plastic bags that everyone has been saving for years!

Congratulations to our high school individual state speech competitors!

In February, we had nine individuals qualify for state speech. Due to the school closures, our students were not able to attend the regularly scheduled state speech contest. Instead, five of our students chose to compete in a virtual state contest via Google Hangout this past weekend. It was a new experience for all, but our students did phenomenally. All five students received straight 1 ratings and finished with Division 1 ratings (the highest score possible). Congratulations!

Division 1 State Speech Ratings:
Cari Walton (senior): Solo Musical Theater
Zach Pleggenkuhle (junior): Public Address
London Wille (junior): After Dinner Speaking
Shae Bernhardt (sophomore): Solo Musical Theater
Meridan Boyd (sophomore): Solo Musical Theater

And congratulations to Meridan Boyd for being selected for All-State Speech for 2020 for her solo musical theater!

As you know, our beloved son and brother Harrison passed away on February 3. Please see the attached form for needed information. All applications can be emailed to melanie.smith@vmbulldogs.com no later than May 8 at 11:00pm.

Please use a format you are comfortable with if you are unable to print and scan. Thank you so much for giving us this opportunity to honor Harrison in this way.

With love,
Mark, Melanie, Cameron, Marshall and of course Harrison Smith ‚ù§

Hello, high school students!

Each Friday going forward, DMACC will be hosting ZOOM calls with local professionals to introduce students to career pathways and local businesses. Sessions are intended for current high school students as well as college students who are exploring educational and career options.

Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks!

Melanie Hopkins

Students, parents and staff,

Hope everyone is safe in these unprecedented times. Please continue to practice social distancing whenever possible. We can all do our part.

The Iowa High School Athletic Directors Association (IHSADA) is encouraging all Iowa schools to participate in "Light Up Iowa" by lighting up our stadiums at 8:00 pm each Friday night. At 8:00 weekly on Friday night we will be turning on the lights to our athletic fields and leave them on for one minute for each day we have been out of school. Van Meter will be participating in this to show our unity during this difficult time. We do not want anyone on the fields at these times. We are all trying to show support for one another and this is a small way Van Meter school will be showing that support.

Hopefully if everyone does their part we will be able to get back together sooner rather than later.

Be safe and take care of yourselves.

Green Iowa AmeriCorps - Sustainable Schools
January 17 at 9:31 AM ¬∑

Way to go EcoDAWGs!! On the brink of an impending snow storm, the newly formed Van Meter Schools green club, the EcoDAWGs ("They're Mean & Green) showed up the girls' and boys' varsity basketball games last night for their very first sporting event recycling initiative.

Working on branding and raising awareness, they walked around with a giant sign that with different types of recyclable beverage bottles taped to it, reminding spectators to recycle, and a giant green bulldog on the back. Club members placed small recycling containers next to trash and emptied them at half time, and after the games.

They even did some dumpster diving to take things out of trash cans that could be recycled! These middle school students are All Stars. Way to go ECODAWGS!!!!!!!
